page.title: 13FARMING IN BAMFURLONG
page.content: Mr Mather of Lily Farm rents an arable farm in the North East of Bamfurlong. He has 200 acres on both sides of the road, 30 acres are wheat, some of which is sown in Spring the rest in Winter. Another 114 acres are barley, then there are 11 acres of potatoes, 18 acres of peas and 27 acres of rape seed. The cereal and pea crop goes for cattle feed. The potatoes go for human consumption. The rape seed is for vegetable oil making in Liverpool. Sometimes the crops are exported to different countries. Bamfurlong used to be called Beanfurlong showing it has a history of farming.
